abstract.text: A Boolean value that indicates whether the view, and its subviews, confine their drawing areas to the bounds of the view.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Setting this value to
causes the view, and its subviews, to clip themselves to the bounds of the view. Setting it to
prevents views and subviews whose frames extend beyond the visible bounds of the view from clipping themselves. A value of
has no effect on
but does affect
, as well as the area drawn inside
By default this value is
. In macOS 13 and earlier, the default value is
Because of this change in default value, views built on macOS 13 and earlier may require layout adjustments such as the following on newer versions of macOS:
Showing or hiding UI elements by setting a parent’s frame size to zero. To hide a view hierarchy by shrinking the parent view, or positioning a child view outside a parent’s bounds, set the
property of the parent view to
. Alternatively, set
to
on the parent view instead.

of a view inside
. It’s a common practice to set the background color on a view by calling

parameter passed into an override of

now extends outside your view’s bounds, call

Differentiating a view’s bounds from its
. Use the
parameter passed to
to determine what to draw, not where to draw it. Use the view’s
to determine the layout of what your view draws.

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
These constants specify the type of a view’s border.
Sets the fill color of subsequent drawing to the color object’s color.
The infrastructure for drawing, printing, and handling events in an app.
Returns a bitmap-representation object suitable for caching the specified portion of the view.
The view’s bounds rectangle, which expresses its location and size in its own coordinate system.
Draws the specified area of the view, and its descendants, into a provided bitmap-representation object.
A Boolean value indicating whether the view can draw its contents on a background thread.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the view, and its subviews, confine their drawing areas to the bounds of the view.
Overridden by subclasses to draw the view’s image within the specified rectangle.
Returns by indirection a list of nonoverlapping rectangles that define the area the view is being asked to draw in
Returns the farthest descendant of the view in the view hierarchy (including itself) that contains a specified point, or
if that point lies completely outside the view.
A Boolean value indicating whether the view is hidden.
Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the specified rectangle intersects any part of the area that the view is being asked to draw.
Updates the view’s content by modifying its underlying layer.
The portion of the view that isn’t clipped by its superviews.
A Boolean value indicating whether AppKit’s default clipping behavior is in effect.
A false value.
A true value.
Type to represent a Boolean value.
A value type whose instances are either `true` or `false`.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
